title: Can I use my Roland E09 as a MIDI keyboard? - Quora

response.answer_text: The E09’s back panel has a MIDI/in jack and a MIDI/out jack. Available MIDI settings: Local on/off, MIDI TxRx on/off, Sync Rx, Style PC, NTA Rx14, Pitch Bend on/off, Modulation on/off, Prog Change on/off, Velo Rx on/off, Clock Tx on/off, Start/Stop on/off. The machine will dump and load SysEx “Bulk Dumps”. Most of the details of the E09’s MIDI implementation are on pages 27–28 of the manual: Roland E-09 Owner's Manual [Page 27]

Yes. The Roland E09 has both Midi and USB outputs available. You can buy a USB A to B cable from Amazon: Bright Hi-Speed USB 2.0 Type A Male to B Male 1.5 Meter Printer Scanner Cable for HP LaserJet 1020 Printer series
